column1: Ocean Acres is an unincorporated community and census-designated place (CDP) split between Barnegat Township and Stafford Township
column4: United States. As of the 2010 United States Census
column7: of which 925 were in Barnegat Township and 15
column8: 217 were in Stafford Township. Ocean Acres is located in the northwestern end of Stafford Township and part of Barnegat Township
column9: and is the newest and biggest part of both communities

column1: Ocean Acres was started in the early 1960s
column2: on a large tract west of the Garden State Parkway sprawling between Stafford Township and Barnegat Townships. Potential buyers were bused to the site and in its first year
column4: 000 lots were sold. The original Ocean Acres development offered three home designs
column5: two ranch styles and a bi-level design. The original models were located on New Jersey Route 72
column6: west of the present site of the Southern Ocean Medical Center
column7: all three are currently used as businesses.

column2: growth on the community was slow. Only a handful of the streets were paved
column3: and most homes were used as summer homes. The community offered several recreation centers
column4: such as a lakefront park near the Nautilus Drive entrance (it was eventually leveled to make way for an expanded lake)
column5: a second lakefront park with tennis and basketball courts off of Forecastle and Canal Drive which doesn't exist anymore
column7: and an 18-hole golf course. The pool has since been removed
column8: but the bathing beach is still open to swimmers after being closed for several years throughout the 1990s. While many original recreational centers original to Ocean Acres
column9: many new parks and recreation centers owned by Stafford Township were built since the 1990s.

column2: a state-mandated moratorium on construction west of the Garden State Parkway had limited the 5
column3: 500-lot community to fewer than 800 homes. In the 1990s
column4: when the moratorium was lifted and sewer lines were installed; development skyrocketed. Several area developers built nearly thousands of homes in the 1990s. Large areas of vacant land in Ocean Acres were even set aside for other individual subdivisions
column5: such as The Oaks at Stafford development. The Ocean Acres Elementary School opened to grades K-2 in 1999.

column1: Development in the Barnegat side of the development was restricted for years due to environmental concerns
column2: development was jump-started in the 2000s starting with the completion of Nautilus Boulevard
column3: which was formerly a "missing link". The Walters Group became the first developer to build in the Barnegat section
column4: an early sales promotion for the Ocean Acres Barnegat homes included a free Toyota Yaris hatchback to be included with the homes.In 2010
column5: the Garden State Parkway exit 67 in Barnegat was redesigned to redirect the southbound exit ramp onto the Lighthouse Drive entrance to Ocean Acres. The opening of the exit and redesign of the interchange fueled growth of the Barnegat section starting in the 2010s
column6: with the opening of a CVS Pharmacy and Wawa
column7: as well as a major shopping center under construction at the intersection.
